## Description {#details}

A concrete instance of a particular driver option.

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arg">Arg</a> class encodes just enough information to be able to derive the argument values efficiently.

Definition at line 34 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h">Arg.h</a>.

### getAlias() {#aadc3b8d31ac039482bfa90b88eb4bc7f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Arg &#42; llvm::opt::Arg::getAlias () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Args are converted to their unaliased form.

For args that originally came from an alias, this returns the alias the arg was produced from.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h/#l00107">107</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h">Arg.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getAsString() {#a63bdece47c81d3a6e63de19cb824b788}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::string Arg::getAsString (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arglist">ArgList</a> &amp; Args) const</>}>
Return a formatted version of the argument and its values, for diagnostics.

Since this is for diagnostics, if this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arg">Arg</a> was produced through an alias, this returns the string representation of the alias that the user wrote.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h/#l00153">153</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h">Arg.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/arg-cpp/#l00066">66</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/arg-cpp">Arg.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getBaseArg() {#a14874091f02f61eef3906ebf03701d05}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Arg &amp; llvm::opt::Arg::getBaseArg () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the base argument which generated this arg.

This is either the argument itself or the argument it was derived from during tool chain specific argument translation.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h/#l00099">99</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h">Arg.h</a>.

### getSpelling() {#a4e47a861c3eadf9c29201f82d126871a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="StringRef llvm::opt::Arg::getSpelling () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the used prefix and name of the option: For <code>--foo=bar</code>, returns <code>--foo=</code>.

This is often the wrong function to call:
<ul>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> <code><a href="#ac268590692356db84db78050196b4940">getValue()</a></code> to get <code>bar</code>.</li>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> <code><a href="#a63bdece47c81d3a6e63de19cb824b788">getAsString()</a></code> to get a string suitable for printing an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arg">Arg</a> in a diagnostic.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h/#l00091">91</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h">Arg.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### renderAsInput() {#a488519e74a0b6299d29bc459588a0329}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Arg::renderAsInput (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arglist">ArgList</a> &amp; Args, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/opt/#a2ceb2416aeccdb4b087e29abc8c6b52f">ArgStringList</a> &amp; Output) const</>}>
Append the argument, render as an input, onto the given array as strings.

The distinction is that some options only render their values when rendered as a input (e.g., Xlinker).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h/#l00144">144</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h">Arg.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/arg-cpp/#l00085">85</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/arg-cpp">Arg.cpp</a>.

## Private Member Attributes

### Alias {#a0b277289b3de52bff4c52dd684e1faf5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;Arg&gt; llvm::opt::Arg::Alias</>}>
If this arg was created through an alias, this is the original alias arg.

For example, &#42;this might be &quot;-finput-charset=utf-8&quot; and Alias might point to an arg representing &quot;/source-charset:utf-8&quot;.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h/#l00070">70</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h">Arg.h</a>.

### Claimed {#ac54d68773d8bdd2aa7c75fe16557e5bc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::opt::Arg::Claimed"
  labels = {["mutable"]}>
Was this argument used to affect compilation?

This is used to generate an &quot;argument unused&quot; warning (without clang::driver::options::TargetSpecific) or &quot;unsupported option&quot; error (with TargetSpecific).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h/#l00055">55</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/arg-h">Arg.h</a>.

### IgnoredTargetSpecific {#af99d36910da8a7b98c9303b566b7bab4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::opt::Arg::IgnoredTargetSpecific">
Used by an unclaimed option with the TargetSpecific flag.

If set, report an &quot;argument unused&quot; warning instead of an &quot;unsupported option&quot; error.
